body.p: In HP Helion OpenStack 2.0, Ceph Monitor Node is installed on the Controller nodes by default. A new monitor node cannot be added to an existing Ceph cluster, if Ceph is deployed with the default configuration. However, if monitor nodes are added on a dedicated resource node then you can add a new monitor node.
If Monitor resource is not already defined, please refer the section Defining Monitor resource and proceed further to add the new monitor node.

p.b: Procedure to add a new monitor node

body.p:
Perform the following procedure to add a new monitor node to an existing Ceph cluster:
Login to the deployer node.
Edit ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/servers.yml to define a new monitor node as shown below:- id: mon4 ip-addr: 192.168.10.11 role: MON-ROLE server-group: RACK3 nic-mapping: MY-2PORT-SERVER mac-addr: 8b:f6:9e:ca:3b:7a ilo-ip: 192.168.9.11 ilo-password: password ilo-user: adminSubstitute the values in above sample as per your environment for the server being added.
Commit your configuration: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "Added monitor node {node-id}"Replace the {node-id} in the commit message with appropriate value (example: mon4).
Execute the following command:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible/ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost cobbler-deploy.yml
Run the following command, which will reimage all the nodes using PXE.ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost bm-reimage.yml
Run the configuration processor:ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Use the playbook below to create a deployment directory: ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Run your "verb_host" commands using the following steps:
cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts guard-deployment.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts osconfig-run.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-deploy.yml
Therefore, the new monitor node is deployed in an existing ceph cluster.

p.b: Verify the newly added monitor node

body.p: From the deployer node, execute the following command:ceph --cluster ceph -f json quorum_statusIf the Ceph cluster name is different than the default (i.e. ceph), you need to modify the above command accordingly.
Observe that the newly added monitor's host name appears in the quorum_names section of the output of above command.
